buddhist.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not believe anything, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What we think, we become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Understanding is the heartwood of the tree of life, and without it, all the leaves and branches are withered.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Teach this triple truth to all: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things which renew humanity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Nothing is permanent. Everything changes.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things which renew humanity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: May all beings be happy.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you light a lamp for someone else, it will also brighten your own path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world—above, below, and across—unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot exist without a spiritual life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An ungrateful mind is a monster, which devours that by which it is nourished.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To conquer oneself is a greater task than conquering others.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Give up the past, give up the future, give up the present. Cross over to the farther shore of existence. With mind wholly liberated, you will not again return to birth and decay.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your life is your message to the world. Make sure it's inspiring.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Silence the angry man with love. Silence the ill-willed man with kindness. Silence the miser with generosity. Silence the liar with truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear. It is the storm within which endangers us, not the storm without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Live in joy, in love, even among those who hate. Live in joy, in health, even among those who are afflicted. Live in joy, in peace, even among those who are troubled. Look within, awaken to your true nature.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A dog is not considered a good dog because he is a good barker. A man is not considered a good man because he is a good talker.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you truly loved yourself, you would never harm another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The past is already gone, the future is not yet here. There is only one moment for you to live, and that is the present moment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on them?
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Conquer the angry one by love. Conquer the evil one by good. Conquer the stingy one by giving. Conquer the liar by truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not be led by others, make your own decision.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Purity or impurity depends on oneself; no one can purify another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest gift is the gift of peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The end of suffering is the awakening to the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot exist without a spiritual life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on them?
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a long road to life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Conquer the angry one by love. Conquer the evil one by good. Conquer the stingy one by giving. Conquer the liar by truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Avoid evil, do good, purify the mind. This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only way to happiness is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; otherwise, your will be an enemy.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be kind to all, to love all, to serve all, to be happy, to be contented, to be peaceful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn’t learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn’t learn a little, at least we didn’t get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn’t die; so, let us all be thankful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years without seeing the highest truth, is one day of life seeing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Purity or impurity depends on oneself; no one can purify another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is patience.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Meditate. Live purely. Be quiet. Do your work with mastery. Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds! Shine.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Abandon attachment to any and all things.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: One day's practice is better than a thousand years of thinking.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There is no path to happiness. Happiness is the path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise man is one who knows what he does not know.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The tongue is a sharp knife that kills without drawing blood.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless – like water.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Have compassion for all beings, rich and poor alike; each has their suffering. Some suffer too much, others too little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to know your past, look into your present condition. If you want to know your future, look into your present actions.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To abstain from all evil, to cultivate good, and to purify one's mind – this is the teaching of the Buddhas.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear. Never fear what will become of you, depend on no one. Only the moment you reject all help are you freed.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There is no fire like passion, no shark like hatred, no snare like folly, no torrent like greed.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Everything is impermanent.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Speak or act with an impure mind and trouble will follow you as the wheel follows the ox that draws the cart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest delusion is fear.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Looking at a tree is looking at meditation.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Know from experience that no pleasure is a good thing if it brings a later pain.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your most precious possession is not your financial assets. Your most precious possession is your time. You may or may not get more money, but you will never get more time.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be attached to nothing, to want nothing, to love nothing.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What is essential is to practice, not to know.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Happiness does not depend on what you have or who you are. It solely relies on how you think.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Like a lotus flower, we too have the ability to rise from the mud, bloom out of the darkness and radiate into the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to keep your memories, you have to keep your mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who loves 50 people has 50 woes; he who loves no one has no woes.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The gift of truth excels all other gifts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is hard to check, swift, it flies wherever it wishes. To tame it is good. A tamed mind brings happiness.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest blessing is contentment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: As a bee gathers nectar without harming the flower, so should a sage move through life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your own self is your master; who else could be? With self-control, you gain a master hard to find.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let go of the past, let go of the future, let go of the present, and cross over to the other shore.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who acts under the impulse of his desires is carried along by the stream.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Like a deep lake, clear and still, so a wise person becomes peaceful upon hearing the teachings.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Speak only words that are kind, peaceful, and truthful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not pursue the past. Do not lose yourself in the future. The past no longer is. The future has not yet come. Looking deeply at life as it is in the very here and now, the practitioner dwells in stability and freedom.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to understand your past, look at your present conditions. If you want to understand your future, look at your present actions.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is patience.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world—above, below, and across—unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who experiences the unity of life sees his own Self in all beings, and all beings in his own Self, and looks on everything with an impartial eye.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The truth is not a theory, but a liberation.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot exist without a spiritual life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Know from experience that no pleasure is a good thing if it brings a later pain.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All living beings are subject to decay. Achieve your own salvation with diligence.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The path is not to be found in the sky. The path is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be kind to all, to love all, to serve all, to be happy, to be contented, to be peaceful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than worshipping gods is obedience to the laws of righteousness.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as the river flows into the sea, so all good actions lead to Nirvana.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not be led by others, make your own decision.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander long in the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: One moment can change a day, one day can change a life, one life can change the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest evil is a lack of love and compassion.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise ones who are intent on meditation, who delight in the peace of renunciation, such mindful ones, even the gods admire.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years, not seeing the highest truth, is one day of life seeing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless – like water.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Live purely. Be quiet. Do your work with mastery. Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds! Shine.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The gift of truth excels all other gifts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What you think, you become. What you feel, you attract. What you imagine, you create.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who have failed to work toward the truth have missed the purpose of living.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest medicine is a tranquil mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: As a bee collects nectar and departs without injuring the flower or its color or fragrance, so let the sage dwell in the village.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To abstain from all evil, to cultivate good, and to purify one's mind – this is the teaching of the Buddhas.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Patience is a most necessary quality for business.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Wear your best clothes and put on your best face for the world, but don't forget to take care of your inner self.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise speak of the way as the end of suffering.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Give up the past, give up the future, give up the present. Cross over to the farther shore of existence. With mind wholly liberated, you will not again return to birth and decay.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Even as a solid rock is not shaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years, knowing nothing of the highest truth, is one day of life knowing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is to have no fear of the unknown.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Understanding is the heartwood of the tree of life, and without it, all the leaves and branches are withered.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Nothing is permanent. Everything changes.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you knew what I know about the power of giving, you would not let a single meal pass without sharing it in some way.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; otherwise, your will be an enemy.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What we think, we become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There is no way to happiness. Happiness is the way.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let us endeavor to live so that when we come to die, even the undertaker will be sorry.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The tongue is a sharp knife that kills without drawing blood.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as the great ocean has one taste, the taste of salt, so also this teaching has one taste, the taste of freedom.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A man is not learned because he speaks much; he who is patient, free from hatred and fear, he is called learned.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your life is your message to the world. Make sure it's inspiring.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Whatever a person does, that will be his inheritance.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest delusion is fear.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: One moment can change a day, one day can change a life, one life can change the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on them?
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Silence the angry man with love. Silence the ill-willed man with kindness. Silence the miser with generosity. Silence the liar with truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear. It is the storm within which endangers us, not the storm without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things which renew humanity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Conquer the angry one by love. Conquer the evil one by good. Conquer the stingy one by giving. Conquer the liar by truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you light a lamp for someone else, it will also brighten your own path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An ungrateful mind is a monster, which devours that by which it is nourished.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a tree, though cut down, sprouts up again if its roots are undamaged and strong, so also, if the roots of craving are not destroyed, the suffering sprouts forth again and again.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest victory is that over oneself.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only way to happiness is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not pursue the past. Do not lose yourself in the future. The past no longer is. The future has not yet come. Looking deeply at life as it is in the very here and now, the practitioner dwells in stability and freedom.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To conquer oneself is a greater task than conquering others.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest blessing is to have no needs.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years, not seeing the highest truth, is one day of life seeing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn’t learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn’t learn a little, at least we didn’t get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn’t die; so, let us all be thankful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless – like water. If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup. You put water into a bottle and it becomes the bottle. You put it in a teapot, it becomes the teapot. Now, water can flow or it can crash. Be water, my friend.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your own self is your master; who else could be? With self-control, you gain a master hard to find.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is patience.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is hard to check, swift, it flies wherever it wishes. To tame it is good. A tamed mind brings happiness.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who loves 50 people has 50 woes; he who loves no one has no woes.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot exist without a spiritual life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Nothing is permanent. Everything changes.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you knew what I know about the power of giving, you would not let a single meal pass without sharing it in some way.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; otherwise, your will be an enemy.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What we think, we become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let us endeavor to live so that when we come to die, even the undertaker will be sorry.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest delusion is fear.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest evil is a lack of love and compassion.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise ones who are intent on meditation, who delight in the peace of renunciation, such mindful ones, even the gods admire.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on them?
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Silence the angry man with love. Silence the ill-willed man with kindness. Silence the miser with generosity. Silence the liar with truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear. It is the storm within which endangers us, not the storm without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things which renew humanity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Conquer the angry one by love. Conquer the evil one by good. Conquer the stingy one by giving. Conquer the liar by truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you light a lamp for someone else, it will also brighten your own path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An ungrateful mind is a monster, which devours that by which it is nourished.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a tree, though cut down, sprouts up again if its roots are undamaged and strong, so also, if the roots of craving are not destroyed, the suffering sprouts forth again and again.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest victory is that over oneself.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The secret of Buddhism is to remove all ideas, all concepts, in order for the truth to have a chance to penetrate, to sink in.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be truly happy and free, you must love yourself.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only constant in life is change.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not speak badly of others. Do not find fault with others. Do not criticize. If you are angry, say nothing. If you find fault, say nothing. If you find something good, speak of it.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Understanding is the heartwood of the tree of life, and without it, all the leaves and branches are withered.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on them?
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your own self is your master; who else could be? With self-control, you gain a master hard to find.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a long road to life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What we think, we become.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The past is already gone, the future is not yet here. There is only one moment for you to live, and that is the present moment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not pursue the past. Do not lose yourself in the future. The past no longer is. The future has not yet come.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The gift of truth excels all other gifts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you truly loved yourself, you would never harm another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest medicine is a tranquil mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: As a bee collects nectar and departs without injuring the flower or its color or fragrance, so let the sage dwell in the village.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To abstain from all evil, to cultivate good, and to purify one's mind – this is the teaching of the Buddhas.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Patience is a most necessary quality for business.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise speak of the way as the end of suffering.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Give up the past, give up the future, give up the present. Cross over to the farther shore of existence. With mind wholly liberated, you will not again return to birth and decay.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Even as a solid rock is not shaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years, knowing nothing of the highest truth, is one day of life knowing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is to have no fear of the unknown.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you knew what I know about the power of giving, you would not let a single meal pass without sharing it in some way.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; otherwise, your will be an enemy.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An ungrateful mind is a monster, which devours that by which it is nourished.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a tree, though cut down, sprouts up again if its roots are undamaged and strong, so also, if the roots of craving are not destroyed, the suffering sprouts forth again and again.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest victory is that over oneself.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The mind is hard to check, swift, it flies wherever it wishes. To tame it is good. A tamed mind brings happiness.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest blessing is contentment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: As a bee gathers nectar without harming the flower, so should a sage move through life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your own self is your master; who else could be? With self-control, you gain a master hard to find.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Let go of the past, let go of the future, let go of the present, and cross over to the other shore.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who acts under the impulse of his desires is carried along by the stream.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Like a deep lake, clear and still, so a wise person becomes peaceful upon hearing the teachings.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Speak only words that are kind, peaceful, and truthful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not pursue the past. Do not lose yourself in the future. The past no longer is. The future has not yet come. Looking deeply at life as it is in the very here and now, the practitioner dwells in stability and freedom.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to understand your past, look at your present conditions. If you want to understand your future, look at your present actions.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest prayer is patience.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world—above, below, and across—unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: He who experiences the unity of life sees his own Self in all beings, and all beings in his own Self, and looks on everything with an impartial eye.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The truth is not a theory, but a liberation.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot exist without a spiritual life.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Know from experience that no pleasure is a good thing if it brings a later pain.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: All living beings are subject to decay. Achieve your own salvation with diligence.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The path is not to be found in the sky. The path is in the heart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be kind to all, to love all, to serve all, to be happy, to be contented, to be peaceful.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than worshipping gods is obedience to the laws of righteousness.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Just as the river flows into the sea, so all good actions lead to Nirvana.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Do not be led by others, make your own decision.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander long in the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: One moment can change a day, one day can change a life, one life can change the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest evil is a lack of love and compassion.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise ones who are intent on meditation, who delight in the peace of renunciation, such mindful ones, even the gods admire.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Better than living a hundred years, not seeing the highest truth, is one day of life seeing the highest truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Empty your mind, be formless, shapeless – like water.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Live purely. Be quiet. Do your work with mastery. Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds! Shine.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The gift of truth excels all other gifts.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What you think, you become. What you feel, you attract. What you imagine, you create.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who have failed to work toward the truth have missed the purpose of living.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Your most precious possession is not your financial assets. Your most precious possession is your time.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: A dog is not considered a good dog because he is a good barker. A man is not considered a good man because he is a good talker.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Purity or impurity depends on oneself; no one can purify another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you truly loved yourself, you would never harm another.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There is no fire like passion, no shark like hatred, no snare like folly, no torrent like greed.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Everything is impermanent.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Speak or act with an impure mind and trouble will follow you as the wheel follows the ox that draws the cart.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Looking at a tree is looking at meditation.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Know from experience that no pleasure is a good thing if it brings a later pain.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: To be attached to nothing, to want nothing, to love nothing.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: What is essential is to practice, not to know.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Happiness does not depend on what you have or who you are. It solely relies on how you think.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Like a lotus flower, we too have the ability to rise from the mud, bloom out of the darkness and radiate into the world.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to keep your memories, you have to keep your mind.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The greatest gift is the gift of peace.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The end of suffering is the awakening to the truth.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: One day's practice is better than a thousand years of thinking.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: There is no path to happiness. Happiness is the path.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The wise man is one who knows what he does not know.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: The tongue is a sharp knife that kills without drawing blood.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: Have compassion for all beings, rich and poor alike; each has their suffering. Some suffer too much, others too little.
buddhist.author: Buddha

buddhist.text: If you want to know your past, look into your present condition. If you want to know your future, look into your present actions.
buddhist.author: Buddha

motivational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
motivational.author: Steve Jobs

motivational.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
motivational.author: Winston Churchill

motivational.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
motivational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

bible.text: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, to give you hope and a future.
bible.author: Jeremiah 29:11

bible.text: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.
bible.author: Proverbs 3:5

bible.text: I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
bible.author: Philippians 4:13
